name: Besan Chilla
history: Besan Chilla, also known as chickpea flour pancake, is a popular dish in North Indian cuisine. It's a quick and nutritious meal, often enjoyed as a breakfast item or a snack.
description: Besan Chilla is a savory pancake made from gram flour (besan), enriched with vegetables and spices. It's a versatile dish that can be customized with various fillings and toppings.

ingredients.quantity: as required to make a batter

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, water, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to form a smooth batter of pouring consistency.

instructions.title: Add Vegetables
instructions.description: Mix in the chopped onions, tomatoes, green chili, and coriander leaves.

instructions.title: Cook the Chilla
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet and lightly grease it with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it evenly to form a pancake. Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Besan Chilla hot with chutney or yogurt.

tips: Ensure the batter is not too thick; it should easily spread on the skillet.
Adding a bit of fruit salt or baking soda can make the chilla fluffier.
variations: Add grated vegetables like carrots or zucchini for a nutritional boost.
Spice it up with additional spices like cumin or garam masala.

storage.shelfLife: The batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat the chilla on a skillet or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with a wedge of lemon.
